settingsPane.description: Set Stweaks settings to be applyed on BOOT.
settingsPane.name: Global BOOT Settings

spinner.description: Master Switch, Load all settings from all TABS on boot, default is LOAD.
spinner.name: Enable On Boot

spinnerItem.name: Don't load all Settings on boot

button.description: Push to load all tuned settings if master switch is OFF or was OFF, if it was ON when phone booted then no need to push!! wait till you see that settings are loaded
button.name: LOAD ALL
button.label: LOAD ALL

settingsPane.description: The following settings are for all global CPU configuration, use it only if you know what you are doing.
settingsPane.name: CPU Global Settings

spinner.description: Maximum CPU-Speed for CPU0. CPU Frequency steps from 384.000 kHz to 1.890.000 kHz! (Default: 1.890.000 kHz)
spinner.name: Max Normal Frequency

spinner.name: Max Normal Frequency

spinner.description: Maximum CPU-Speed for CPU2. CPU Frequency steps from 384.000 kHz to 1.890.000 kHz! (Default: 1.890.000 kHz)
spinner.name: Max Normal Frequency

spinner.description: Maximum CPU-Speed for CPU3. CPU Frequency steps from 384.000 kHz to 1.890.000 kHz! (Default: 1.890.000 kHz)
spinner.name: Max Normal Frequency

spinner.description: Minimum CPU-Speed for CPU0. CPU Frequency step from 384.000 kHz to 1.890.000 kHz! (Default: 384.000 kHz)
spinner.name: Min Frequency

spinner.description: Minimum CPU-Speed for CPU1. CPU Frequency step from 384.000 kHz to 1.890.000 kHz! (Default: 384.000 kHz)
spinner.name: Min Frequency

spinner.description: Minimum CPU-Speed for CPU2. CPU Frequency step from 384.000 kHz to 1.890.000 kHz! (Default: 384.000 kHz)
spinner.name: Min Frequency

spinner.description: Minimum CPU-Speed for CPU3. CPU Frequency step from 384.000 kHz to 1.890.000 kHz! (Default: 384.000 kHz)
spinner.name: Min Frequency

settingsPane.description: Set CPU settings to save power.
settingsPane.name: CPU Idle and Power Settings

checkbox.description: Disabling GENTLE_FAIR_SLEEPERS may give you better UI responsiveness.
checkbox.name: GENTLE_FAIR_SLEEPERS
checkbox.label: GENTLE_FAIR_SLEEPERS

checkbox.description: Enable ARCH_POWER.
checkbox.name: ARCH_POWER
checkbox.label: ARCH_POWER

checkbox.description: Enable or disable Power-efficient work queues will help to reduce power consumption at the cost of slight performance overhead. By enabling this, PE work queues are used for unbound scheduled work to save load on sibling CPU cores and queuing work on CPU 0.
checkbox.name: Power-efficient work queues
checkbox.label: Power-efficient work queues

spinner.description: Maximum CPUs speed while using GPS. (Default: 1242.000 kHz).
spinner.name: scaling_max_gps_freq

spinner.description: Maximum DEEP SLEEP CPUs speed. (Default: 1242.000 kHz).
spinner.name: scaling_max_suspend_freq

spinner.description: Maximum ON CALL CPUs speed. (Default: 1350.000 kHz). When phone is on call and suspended.
spinner.name: scaling_max_oncall_freq

spinner.description: Minimum DEEP SLEEP CPUs speed. (Default: 384.000 kHz).
spinner.name: scaling_min_suspend_freq

settingsPane.description: CPU Voltage Control. Voltage range is 800.000~1300.000 µV. Lower or higher are NOT SUPPORTED. All is done to prevent BUGS and SODS. Use this interface AT YOUR OWN RISK! If you get SOD before you can load this interface and cannot fix your error, flash another kernel or my cleaning script to reset profiles from recovery!
settingsPane.name: CPU Voltage Controls

checkbox.description: Main switch for Voltage Control. If disabled, all below settings have no effect! If you are using an external application or script to configure CPU voltage, do not tick this checkbox. Do not start to mod voltage before you enable this switch! It will not have any effect and you will have to set all to default, and tune again!
checkbox.name: CPU Voltage Main Switch
checkbox.label: CPU Voltage Main Switch

button.description: Use this button to see what CPU Voltage is used right now!
button.name: Check Active CPU Voltage
button.label: Check CPU Voltage

settingsPane.description: Set advanced governor settings. These settings are active only if the screen is on.
settingsPane.name: Governor Parameters tuning

spinner.description: This will set the CPU0 governor. Default CPU governor will only be set during early stages of booting (before init.d execution), and can be overridden by any other scripts or applications. (Default: Alucard)
spinner.name: Default CPU Governor

spinner.description: This will set the CPU1 governor. Default CPU governor will only be set during early stages of booting (before init.d execution), and can be overridden by any other scripts or applications. (Default: Alucard)
spinner.name: Default CPU Governor

spinner.description: This will set the CPU2 governor. Default CPU governor will only be set during early stages of booting (before init.d execution), and can be overridden by any other scripts or applications. (Default: Alucard)
spinner.name: Default CPU Governor

spinner.description: This will set the CPU3 governor. Default CPU governor will only be set during early stages of booting (before init.d execution), and can be overridden by any other scripts or applications. (Default: Alucard)
spinner.name: Default CPU Governor

button.description: Use this button to push all new changes to the governor in real time!
button.name: GOV Policy Install
button.label: Apply settings to GOV core

settingsPane.description: Global governor Configuration, see descriptions
settingsPane.name: GLOBAL GOV CONFIGURATON

seekBar.description: Measured as percentage, when load on CPU is equal to above up threshold, CPU is scaled Up. Lower value - early scale up, and vice-verse. (Only for HYPER, Ondemand, PegasusQ, Conservative) (Default: 70%)
seekBar.name: up_threshold

seekBar.description: This threshold is used as up threshold while sampling at frequencies less than freq_for_responsiveness. Above that, normal up_threshold is used. This gives the option to make scaling aggressive or relaxed until a frequency and normal for higher frequencies. Again, during calculation of optimal frequency which should not trigger up policy, down threshold to consider is difference between up_threshold_at_min_freq and down_differential. (Only for HYPER, Ondemand and PegasusQ) (Default: 60%)
seekBar.name: up_threshold_at_min_freq

seekBar.description: Sampling Interval, measured in µs. This factor determines how often the governor should poll for CPU usage in terms of frequency and load percentage to make scaling decisions - either scale CPU Up or scale it Down. (Only for HYPER, OnDemand, PegasusQ, Conservative, Nightmare, Darkness, Alucard) (Default: 50.000 µs)
seekBar.name: sampling_rate

seekBar.description: Acts as a multiplier for sampling interval for re-evaluating the load when CPU is truly busy and is on highest clock frequency (policy max). Setting to 1 makes no difference and causes CPU to immediately scale down from highest frequency. Sampling down factor is NOT valid for lower frequencies and low load conditions. Note that CPU is scaled up to max frequency when max_load_freq is greater than up_threshold X current frequency. (or to cur_freq + (freq_step X policy.max_freq) whichever is smaller) Max_load_freq is an arbitrary frequency calculated as the maximum of load_frequencies. (Only for HYPER, Ondemand, PegasusQ, Conservartive) (Default: 1)
seekBar.name: sampling_down_factor

seekBar.description: Defines how much as a percentage of maximum frequency, governor should increase CPU frequency each time CPU load reaches up_threshold or inc_cpu_load. (Only for HYPER, Ondemand, PegasusQ, Nightmare, Conservative) (Default: 30%)
seekBar.name: freq_step

seekBar.description: After spending sampling_down_factor X sampling_rate micro seconds at maximum frequency on high load, governor samples the load again to calculate an approx target frequency to scale-down-to which should not trigger up_threshold in the next sample. (Triggering up threshold may cause jumping to max frequency again). Max_load_freq is checked against (up_threshold - down_differential) X current frequency. If found to be smaller, CPU is scaled down to a target frequency as described above. Down_differential also act as the factor to prevent aggressive scale down. (Only for HYPER, Ondemand, PegasusQ) (default: 5)
seekBar.name: down_differential

spinner.description: Until freq_for_responsiveness, Up Threshold considered for sampling load is up_threshold_at_min_freq. Also during the part where CPU is at maximum load frequency, governor need to find the optimal frequency as the next frequency - which should not trigger up_threshold in the next sampling. When such a frequency_next is found to be a) less than freq_for_responsiveness b) will not trigger down_threshold in the next sample, then the optimal frequency is set to freq_for_responsiveness. (Only for HYPER, PegasusQ, Nightmare) (Default: 486.000 kHz)
spinner.name: freq_for_responsiveness

seekBar.description: This is same as the up_threshold found for the Ondemand governor but for the opposite direction. For example when set to its default value of 30 it means that if the CPU usage needs to be below 30% between samples to have the frequency decreased. (Only for Conservative) (Default: 30%)
seekBar.name: down_threshold

settingsPane.description: Nightmare, Darkness and Alucard governor Configuration, see descriptions
settingsPane.name: NIGHTMARE | DARKNESS | ALUCARD GOV CONFIGURATON

seekBar.description: This threshold is used as up threshold while sampling at frequencies less than freq_for_responsiveness. Above that, normal inc_cpu_load is used. This gives us an option to make scaling aggressive/relaxed until a frequency and normal for higher frequencies. (Only for Nightmare, Alucard). (Default: 60%)
seekBar.name: inc_cpu_load_at_min_freq

seekBar.description: The frequency at which governor scales CPU up. Load big or equal inc_cpu_load: cpu scaled up. (Only for Nightmare, Alucard). (Default: 70%)
seekBar.name: inc_cpu_load

seekBar.description: This threshold is used as down threshold while sampling at frequencies less than freq_responsiveness. Above that, normal dec_cpu_load is used. This gives us an option to make scaling aggressive/relaxed until a frequency and normal for higher frequencies. (Only for Alucard). (Default: 60%)
seekBar.name: dec_cpu_load_at_min_freq

seekBar.description: The frequency at which governor scales CPU down. Load less than dec_cpu_load: cpu scaled down. (Only for Nightmare, Alucard). (Default: 70%)
seekBar.name: dec_cpu_load

spinner.description: When current freq is greater than freq_for_responsiviness_max, freq_step_dec will be equal to freq_step_dec_at_max_freq. (Only for Nightmare). (Default: 1890.000 kHz)
spinner.name: freq_for_responsiveness_max

spinner.description: Until freq_responsiveness, Up Threshold considered for sampling load is inc_cpu_load_at_min_freq. Also during the part where CPU is at maximum load frequency, governor need to find the optimal frequency as the next frequency - which should not trigger up_threshold in the next sampling. When such a frequency_next is found to be a) less than freq_responsiveness b) will not trigger down_threshold in the next sample, then the optimal frequency is set to freq_responsiveness. (Only for Alucard) (Default: 1134.000 kHz)
spinner.name: freq_responsiveness

seekBar.description: Governor should increase CPU0 frequency by n step each time CPU load reaches inc_cpu_load_at_min_freq. (Only for Alucard) (Default: 2)
seekBar.name: pump_inc_step_at_min_freq_1

seekBar.description: Governor should increase CPU1 frequency by n step each time CPU load reaches inc_cpu_load_at_min_freq. (Only for Alucard) (Default: 2)
seekBar.name: pump_inc_step_at_min_freq_2

seekBar.description: Governor should increase CPU2 frequency by n step each time CPU load reaches inc_cpu_load_at_min_freq. (Only for Alucard) (Default: 2)
seekBar.name: pump_inc_step_at_min_freq_3

seekBar.description: Governor should increase CPU3 frequency by n step each time CPU load reaches inc_cpu_load_at_min_freq. (Only for Alucard) (Default: 2)
seekBar.name: pump_inc_step_at_min_freq_4

seekBar.description: Governor should increase CPU0 frequency by n step each time CPU load reaches inc_cpu_load. (Only for Alucard) (Default: 2)
seekBar.name: pump_inc_step_1

seekBar.description: Governor should increase CPU1 frequency by n step each time CPU load reaches inc_cpu_load. (Only for Alucard) (Default: 2)
seekBar.name: pump_inc_step_2

seekBar.description: Governor should increase CPU2 frequency by n step each time CPU load reaches inc_cpu_load. (Only for Alucard) (Default: 2)
seekBar.name: pump_inc_step_3

seekBar.description: Governor should increase CPU3 frequency by n step each time CPU load reaches inc_cpu_load. (Only for Alucard) (Default: 2)
seekBar.name: pump_inc_step_4

seekBar.description: Governor should decrease CPU0 frequency by n step each time CPU load is below inc_cpu_load_at_min_freq. (Only for Alucard) (Default: 2)
seekBar.name: pump_dec_step_at_min_freq_1

seekBar.description: Governor should decrease CPU1 frequency by n step each time CPU load is below inc_cpu_load_at_min_freq. (Only for Alucard) (Default: 2)
seekBar.name: pump_dec_step_at_min_freq_2

seekBar.description: Governor should decrease CPU2 frequency by n step each time CPU load is below inc_cpu_load_at_min_freq. (Only for Alucard) (Default: 2)
seekBar.name: pump_dec_step_at_min_freq_3

seekBar.description: Governor should decrease CPU3 frequency by n step each time CPU load is below inc_cpu_load_at_min_freq. (Only for Alucard) (Default: 2)
seekBar.name: pump_dec_step_at_min_freq_4

seekBar.description: Governor should decrease CPU0 frequency by n step each time CPU load reaches dec_cpu_load. (Only for Alucard) (Default: 1)
seekBar.name: pump_dec_step_1

seekBar.description: Governor should decrease CPU1 frequency by n step each time CPU load reaches dec_cpu_load. (Only for Alucard) (Default: 1)
seekBar.name: pump_dec_step_2

seekBar.description: Governor should decrease CPU2 frequency by n step each time CPU load reaches dec_cpu_load. (Only for Alucard) (Default: 1)
seekBar.name: pump_dec_step_3

seekBar.description: Governor should decrease CPU3 frequency by n step each time CPU load reaches dec_cpu_load. (Only for Alucard) (Default: 1)
seekBar.name: pump_dec_step_4

seekBar.description: Defines how much as a percentage of maximum frequency, governor should increase CPU frequency each time CPU load reaches inc_cpu_load_at_min_freq. (Only for nightmare). (Default: 30%)
seekBar.name: freq_step_at_min_freq

seekBar.description: Brake scale up frequency when load big or equal inc_cpu_load_at_min_freq. (Only for Nightmare). (Default: 20)
seekBar.name: freq_up_brake_at_min_freq

seekBar.description: Brake scale up frequency when load big or equal inc_cpu_load. (Only for Nightmare). (Default: 20)
seekBar.name: freq_up_brake

seekBar.description: Defines how much as a percentage of maximum frequency, governor should decrease CPU frequency each time CPU load reaches dec_cpu_load. Only for Nightmare). Default: 10%)
seekBar.name: freq_step_dec

seekBar.description: Defines how much as a percentage of maximum frequency, governor should decrease CPU frequency each time CPU load reaches dec_cpu_load and current freq is greater than freq_for_responsiviness_max. (Only for Nightmare). (Default: 10%)
seekBar.name: freq_step_dec_at_max_freq

seekBar.description: Number of samples to evaluate cpus frequency scaling up when current cpu frequency is greater than freq_responsiveness. (Default: 1)
seekBar.name: cpus_up_rate

seekBar.description: Number of samples to evaluate cpu frequency scaling down when current cpu frequency is greater than freq_responsiveness. (Default: 1)
seekBar.name: cpus_down_rate

settingsPane.description: Tune CPU hotplugging
settingsPane.name: Cpu hotplug Tuning

spinner.description: Set the CPU hotplugging system. (Default: ALUCARD HOTPLUG)
spinner.name: cpu hotplugging

button.description: Use this button to push all new changes to CPU hotplugging system in real time! The sleep tuning will be auto added on screen off.
button.name: Cpu Hotplug Policy Install
button.label: Apply settings to HOTPLUG core

settingsPane.description: Tune alucard hotplug
settingsPane.name: alucard hotplug Tuning

seekBar.description: Sampling Interval, measured in ms. This factor determines how often the governor should poll for CPU usage in terms of frequency and load percentage to make hotplugging decisions. (Default: 50 ms)
seekBar.name: hotplug_sampling_rate

seekBar.description: Number of samples to evaluate cpu1 hotplug in. (Default: 1)
seekBar.name: hotplug_rate_1_1

seekBar.description: Number of samples to evaluate cpu1 hotplug out. (Default: 1)
seekBar.name: hotplug_rate_2_0

seekBar.description: Number of samples to evaluate cpu2 hotplug in. (Default: 2)
seekBar.name: hotplug_rate_2_1

seekBar.description: Number of samples to evaluate cpu2 hotplug out. (Default: 2)
seekBar.name: hotplug_rate_3_0

seekBar.description: Number of samples to evaluate cpu3 hotplug in. (Default: 2)
seekBar.name: hotplug_rate_3_1

seekBar.description: Number of samples to evaluate cpu3 hotplug out. (Default: 2)
seekBar.name: hotplug_rate_4_0

spinner.description: Up threshold frequency to turn second core On, when some other conditions is also met. ie If (minimum frequency greater than or equal to hotplug_freq 1 1) Hotplug IN Second Core. Higher value corresponds to delay in turning on second core. (Default: 1242.000 kHz)
spinner.name: hotplug_freq_1_1

spinner.description: Down threshold frequency to turn second core Off, when some other conditions is also met. ie If (maximum frequency less than hotplug_freq 2 0) Hotplug OUT Second Core. Lower value corresponds to delay in turning off second core. (Default: 810.000 kHz)
spinner.name: hotplug_freq_2_0

spinner.description: Up threshold frequency to turn third core On, when some other conditions is also met. ie If (minimum frequency greater than or equal to hotplug_freq 2 1) Hotplug IN Third Core. Higher value corresponds to delay in turning on Third core. (Default: 1242.000 kHz)
spinner.name: hotplug_freq_2_1

spinner.description: Down threshold frequency to turn third core Off, when some other conditions is also met. ie If (maximum frequency less than hotplug_freq 3 0) Hotplug OUT Third Core. Lower value corresponds to delay in turning off third core. (Default: 810.000 kHz)
spinner.name: hotplug_freq_3_0

spinner.description: Up threshold frequency to turn fourth core On, when some other conditions is also met. ie If (minimum frequency greater than or equal to hotplug_freq 3 1) Hotplug IN Fourth Core. Higher value corresponds to delay in turning on Fourth core. (Default: 1242.000 kHz)
spinner.name: hotplug_freq_3_1

spinner.description: Down threshold frequency to turn fourth core Off, when some other conditions is also met. ie If (maximum frequency less than hotplug_freq 4 0) Hotplug OUT Fourth Core. Lower value corresponds to delay in turning off fourth core. (Default: 810.000 kHz)
spinner.name: hotplug_freq_4_0

seekBar.description: The CPU load at which governor scales CPU up. Current Load equal or greater than up_load: CPU Hotplug IN. Value corresponding to 101 causes not HOTPLUG IN. (Default: 60%)
seekBar.name: hotplug_load_1_1

seekBar.description: The CPU load at which governor scales CPU down. Current Load less than down_load and CPU online greater than 1: CPU Hotplug OUT. Value corresponding to 101 causes immediately HOTPLUG OUT. (Default: 20%)
seekBar.name: hotplug_load_2_0

seekBar.description: The CPU load at which governor scales CPU up. Current Load equal or greater than up_load: CPU Hotplug IN. Value corresponding to 101 causes not HOTPLUG IN. (Default: 60%)
seekBar.name: hotplug_load_2_1

seekBar.description: The CPU load at which governor scales CPU down. Current Load less than down_load and CPU online greater than 1: CPU Hotplug OUT. Value corresponding to 101 causes immediately HOTPLUG OUT. (Default: 20%)
seekBar.name: hotplug_load_3_0

seekBar.description: The CPU load at which governor scales CPU up. Current Load equal or greater than up_load: CPU Hotplug IN. Value corresponding to 101 causes not HOTPLUG IN. (Default: 60%)
seekBar.name: hotplug_load_3_1

seekBar.description: The CPU load at which governor scales CPU down. Current Load less than down_load and CPU online greater than 1: CPU Hotplug OUT. Value corresponding to 101 causes immediately HOTPLUG OUT. (Default: 20%)
seekBar.name: hotplug_load_4_0

seekBar.description: Threshold run queue length for second core to turn on. (Default: 100)
seekBar.name: hotplug_rq_1_1

seekBar.description: Threshold run queue length for second core to turn off. (Default: 100)
seekBar.name: hotplug_rq_2_0

seekBar.description: Threshold run queue length for third core to turn on. (Default: 150)
seekBar.name: hotplug_rq_2_1

seekBar.description: Threshold run queue length for third core to turn off. (Default: 150)
seekBar.name: hotplug_rq_3_0

seekBar.description: Threshold run queue length for fourth core to turn on. (Default: 150)
seekBar.name: hotplug_rq_3_1

seekBar.description: Threshold run queue length for fourth core to turn off. (Default: 150)
seekBar.name: hotplug_rq_4_0

seekBar.description: Max CPU's hotplugging limit. (Default: 4)
seekBar.name: maxcoreslimit

seekBar.description: Max CPU's hotplugging limit. (Default: 2)
seekBar.name: maxcoreslimit_sleep

settingsPane.description: Tune MSM Hotplug
settingsPane.name: MSM Hotplug Tuning

spinner.description: MSM HotPlug additional CPU control, here you can tune how much cores will be active on high short load, default is 2 cores for 4sec, if you wish to save more power when using MSM HotPlug then best to use 1 core. or if performance is what you prefer then use 2 cores boost. Depend on MSM HotPlug selected!
spinner.name: MSM HotPlug Booster

settingsPane.description: Tune in Common
settingsPane.name: Common

spinner.description: CPU HotPlug Suspend Control - you can allow hotplug to be suspended when screen is OFF to save little more power on deepsleep, then resume when screen is ON, BUT it will DELAY In Call screen wakeup! for 3sec as when screen is OFF, you have only ONE core active with suspend mode. also using suspend mode can prevent wake up for some devices for unknown reason!!!. so if you wish to test suspend mode go ahead, if you get SOD switch to Always Active mode and stay there (default mode). for many it's working fine. this is for all kernel hotplugs, default hotplug is not supported.
spinner.name: Hot Plug Suspend Mode

seekBar.description: Set minimum number of cpus online. (Alucard Hotplug, IntelliPlug, MSM Hotplug) (Default: 1)
seekBar.name: min_cpus_online

seekBar.description: Set maximum number of cpus online. (IntelliPlug, MSM Hotplug) (Default: 4)
seekBar.name: max_cpus_online

settingsPane.description: Tune the msm thermal module
settingsPane.name: MSM Thermal Tuning

spinner.description: CPU Thermal control, Can be Default driver without controls, or Intelli thermal driver with controls below or Dual Intelligent Thermal driver with controls below and ROM thermal control, its will limit CPU frequency when CPU reach the max limit heat, till cooled and restore full power, this can help with too hot phone playing games! intelli driver is more aggressive and drop freq to 1.4 then to 1.2 then to 1.1ghz that will reduce performance in all bench apps! defaut will lock on 1.9Ghz most of the time, and burn the fingers but give you more SCORE to show off.
spinner.name: CPU Temp Control

spinner.description: Hotplug CPU Thermal control main switch, this allow to shutdown cores 1,2,3 and leave core 0 as main core on high frequency. but it reduces global performance on high temp, if set disabled then all CPU cores will be online and operate at lower frequencies when the temperature is high!
spinner.name: HotPlug Thermal CPU Control

spinner.description: Here you can control how many cores will stay active on high temp, more cores OFF will give you higher frequency on cores that remain Online, disabled Cores can go online by auto if temp is below the set mark in control below, Change will take effect ONLY on LOW Temp! do not change on high CPU stress, depend on Hotplug CPU Thermal control Enabled above!
spinner.name: Max online CPU's

seekBar.description: Set CORES max HEAT before turning OFF cores from 3 to 1 and keep normal phone heat, if you tune above CPU max TEMP below, then all cores will stay ON when over heatted! This will work only with Intelli Temp Control ON!!!
seekBar.name: CORE Max Heat

seekBar.description: Set CPU max HEAT before throttled down to cool and keep normal phone heat, depend on CPU Thermal control ON!
seekBar.name: CPU Max Heat

seekBar.description: Thermal throttling stop when cpu temperature is less than limit_temp_degC minus temp_hysteresis_degC.
seekBar.name: CPU Max Heat

settingsPane.description: Tune GPU
settingsPane.name: Gpu Tuning

spinner.description: This will set GPU governor. (Default: ondemand)
spinner.name: GPU Governor

spinner.description: This it is the max value of GPU frequency. (Default: 450.000 kHz)
spinner.name: GPU Max Frequency

spinner.description: This it is the min value of GPU frequency. (Default: 128.000 kHz)
spinner.name: GPU Min Frequency

spinner.description: This it is the thermal value of GPU frequency. (Default: 450.000 kHz)
spinner.name: GPU thermal Frequency

settingsPane.description: GPU Voltage Control. FOR ADVANCED USERS ONLY! USE IT AT YOUR OWN RISK!!!
settingsPane.name: GPU Voltage Control

checkbox.description: Main switch for Voltage Control. If disabled, all below settings have no effect! If you are using an external application or script to configure GPU voltage, do not tick this checkbox. Do not start to mod voltage before you enable this switch! It will not have any effect and you will have to set all to default, and tune again!
checkbox.name: GPU Voltage Main Switch
checkbox.label: GPU Voltage Main Switch

seekBar.description: GPU Voltage for the first (lowest) step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level1. (Default: 945000)

seekBar.description: GPU Voltage for the second (mid) step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level2. (Default: 1050000)

seekBar.description: GPU Voltage for the third (highest) step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level3. (Default: 1150000)

settingsPane.description: Set BOOST Touch options
settingsPane.name: Touch Boost

seekBar.description: When the screen is touched the initial boost (minimum CPU frequency) is set to this value for the duration set in (input_boost_ms). From 810.000 kHz to 1.890.000 kHz (Default: 1.134.000 kHz)
seekBar.name: input_boost_freq

settingsPane.description: Set Boost Touch time
settingsPane.name: Touch Time

seekBar.description: Duration of the initial boost period (input_boost_freq). From 20 ms to 500 ms (Default: 50 ms)
seekBar.name: input_boost_ms

seekBar.description: Here you can set Touch Boost interval in micro seconds! 100ms is equal 0.1sec, when touch screen report touch here we set timer for how long to wait before setting core min frequency for duration above, this is Ultra Fast even on 500ms
seekBar.name: CPU Touch Boost Interval

settingsPane.description: Set Boost Touch nr. cpus
settingsPane.name: Touch Boost Cpus

seekBar.description: Number of cpus affected by touchboost control. From 1 cpu to 4 cpus (Default: 2 cpus)
seekBar.name: nr_boost_cpus

settingsPane.description: Tune IO settings managed by Kernel
settingsPane.name: IO Tuning

seekBar.description: Maximum number of kilobytes to read-ahead for INTERNAL SDCARD! file systems on this device. (Default: 1024 kB)
seekBar.name: kilobytes to read-ahead

seekBar.description: Maximum number of kilobytes to read-ahead for EXTERNAL SDCARD! file systems on this device. (Default: 1024 kB)
seekBar.name: kilobytes to read-ahead

spinner.description: MMC power usage control, when set performance mode MMC I/O write speed will be very fast, when set in power save mode write performance will be degraded but more power saved.
spinner.name: MMC Power Usage

spinner.description: This will set the default IO scheduler for internal sdcard. A reboot should be performed when this value is changed. (Default: BFQ)
spinner.name: Default IO Scheduler Int.

spinner.description: This will set the default IO scheduler for external sdcard. A reboot should be performed when this value is changed. (Default: BFQ)
spinner.name: Default IO Scheduler Ext.

settingsPane.description: Tune memory and OOM (low mem management) settings managed by Kernel.
settingsPane.name: Memory Tuning

checkbox.description: Enable AUTO OOM control using below profiles, disable if you want to set your own OOM tuning via APP or Script.
checkbox.name: Auto OOM
checkbox.label: AUTO OOM CONTROL

checkbox.description: Adaptive LMK help to free RAM more faster when low RAM condition exist and vmpressure is in range of 85-94, apps cleaned from RAM to allow smooth ROM operation and faster load of on screen APP. Enabled by default.
checkbox.name: Adaptive LMK
checkbox.label: Adaptive LMK

seekBar.description: Adaptive LMK trigger point, when ram pressure is higher than set here, LMK is ordered to release RAM fast and allow fast load of something BIG to memory, we see it as fast app load and less LAG. lower the value, then more apps killed from RAM and with less actual need. for best performance keep it in range of 85 to 90%
seekBar.name: Adaptive LMK Pressure Range

seekBar.description: When RAM pressure is higher than set above, and RAM is lower than set here, kernel will start releasing RAM by stopping background apps. Value calculation here is based on this formula PR * 4096 (example: 68 * 4096 = 278MB free RAM) default 68 PR
seekBar.name: Adaptive LMK Lowest RAM Allowed

checkbox.description: Control for kernel process memory reclaim, it help to reduce used RAM of each APP that loaded in background. when vm memory pressure jump higher and system needs RAM for something BIG to load, process reclaim start to shrink used RAM by background APPS, it also shrink the ZRAM swap if enabled in order to reduce cpu power usage if RAM is free.
checkbox.name: Process Memory Reclaim
checkbox.label: Process Reclaim

seekBar.description: Control for max vm pressure for process memory reclaim, allow to shrink RAM from other apps when vm pressure is in range from 50 to set here value. when value is lower that default (80), then less ram shrink when there is something BIG should be loaded to RAM, it will reduce CPU usage when loading big app. but load it slower as memory should be free first by LMK.
seekBar.name: Max Process Reclaim Pressure

spinner.description: Set the level of low mem management by kernel lowmemkiller function. More aggressive, equals more free RAM but more killed apps.
spinner.name: OOM Level Screen ON

spinner.description: Set the level of low mem management by kernel lowmemkiller function. More aggressive equals more free RAM but more killed apps.
spinner.name: OOM Level Screen OFF

spinner.description: Here you can set the low memory reserve ratio, higher ratio give you more free RAM if you see that your free RAM is always loaded and device LAG, but it also uses more battery to gain more free RAM with loaded system. use relaxed ONLY if your free RAM is above 650MB always! if less than 280MB use recommended or high pressure.
spinner.name: Low Memory Reserve

seekBar.description: Dirty background memory buffer. The more you set, the more memory will be used for write buffer for background operations. Buffer is released when it is needed to free RAM
seekBar.name: Dirty Background ratio

seekBar.description: Dirty real time memory buffer, more you set, more memory will be used for write buffer for real time operations. Buffer is released when it is needed to free RAM
seekBar.name: Dirty ratio

seekBar.description: Controls the tendency of the kernel to reclaim the memory which is used for caching of directory and inode objects.
seekBar.name: Vfs Cache Pressure

button.description: Clean RAM Cache. This will release all cached and buffered RAM, please WAIT 3sec to get cleanup report
button.name: CLEAN RAM CACHE
button.label: CLEAN RAM CACHE NOW

settingsPane.description: SWAP control, using storage space in /data to extend real free ram for apps in background. enable only if you have free space and you really need that RAM extension, by using storage swap, you will see slight more battery drain and less I/O read/write speed! can be used with ZRAM below.
settingsPane.name: Linux Swap

spinner.description: Select SWAP size or keep it OFF, it's take time to create swap file, just WAIT will you get notification about size.
spinner.name: SWAP Selector

settingsPane.description: Control ZRAM module, it takes real RAM and compress it by 40% and create much more FREE RAM for apps to use! more RAM allocated for zram then more given to user. but in cost of CPU power and some battery, when switching ZRAM size from one to other after some time, this will take TIME! more than 2min! and Dorimanx app will FREEZE! DO NOT PANIC! WAIT. you can just switch to home and open synapse and watch how memory is decompressed and ZRAM turned off. do not kill the app. just WAIT!
settingsPane.name: ZRAM

spinner.description: ZRAM size controller. more set, more free RAM you will get, in cost of CPU power. but it's low usage. and device is operating GREAT. this is memory based module, so storage is not killed over time. you can see how it works in synapse app! Compression is LZ4, PLEASE read instruction ABOVE about WAITING for selector to switch from one size to other after long usage!!!
spinner.name: ZRAM Selector

seekBar.description: Control for ZRAM Swap allocation, when you set higher here, ZRAM will be used more instead of real RAM and give you more RAM! with light cost of performance (default 60)
seekBar.name: Swappiness

settingsPane.description: Control UKSM module, Ultra KSM lets the hypervisor system share identical memory pages amongst different processes or virtualized guests. This increases CPU consumption but improves memory.
settingsPane.name: UKSM

checkbox.description: UKSM Enable and Disable main switch. (default OFF)
checkbox.name: Ultra Kernel Samepage Merging
checkbox.label: UKSM Switch

spinner.description: UKSM CPU Governor power when screen is ON, you can set high or low operation to scan and share memory across apps. (default is medium)
spinner.name: UKSM CPU AWAKE GOV

spinner.description: UKSM CPU Governor power when screen is OFF, you can set high or low operation to scan and share memory across apps. (default is No Power)
spinner.name: UKSM CPU SLEEP GOV

seekBar.description: The lower is set, more RAM we can gain at cost of slight performance (Default: 1000 ms).
seekBar.name: UKSM Scan Delay Interval

settingsPane.description: Activate some scripts which automatically runs in the background at the specified time.
settingsPane.name: Cron

spinner.description: Cron Tasks Main Switch. If you set this OFF, then all tasks below will have no effect.
spinner.name: Cron Task Master Switch

button.description: Use this button to test, if this Cron Task service is ONLINE and supported. Make sure that Main Switch is ON.
button.name: Test Cron Task Service
button.label: Test Cron Task Service

button.description: Use this button to RESET the scripts and jobs from kernel and refresh the configuration. Note that it will clear all your custom changes!
button.name: CRON Resetter
button.label: Reset Cron

checkbox.description: Cron that clears file-cache every 3 hours, but only if CPU is in idle and when more than 50% of memory is used. This will free RAM from unused buffers and cache.
checkbox.name: Clear file-cache
checkbox.label: Clear RAM cache every 3 hours

checkbox.description: Cron that reset SystemUI memory usage and release locked RAM that can't be freed by kernel, SystemUI service will automatically restart after 5 sec and use from 70 to 90 MiB memory less than before.
checkbox.name: Reset SystemUI
checkbox.label: Reset SystemUI every 02:00 AM

checkbox.description: Enable Trim of System, Data and Cache partitions every day at 10:00 PM to speed up NAND Read and Write Access Time. NOTE that screen will be AWAKE during the fstrim to prevent MMC crash, then if screen was OFF it's will be auto turned off. Some devices don't like to be trimmed, so if device get stuck after 10:00 PM, don't enable this.
checkbox.name: Trim system, data and cache
checkbox.label: Trim every day at 10:00 PM

checkbox.description: Enable reclaiming RAM from apps. It's smart memory kernel feature used to take back all cached RAM from apps without killing them. It helps to maintain stable and fast device for a long time. Task will run in every 3 hours.
checkbox.name: Reclaime RAM from apps
checkbox.label: Reclaim RAM from apps in every 3 hours

checkbox.description: Enable restarting Google Service to prevent memory leaks and CPU nonstop activity. This is one of the MAIN LP RAM leak BUGS. Service gets stuck, drains RAM and force CPU to work nonstop.
checkbox.name: Restart Google Service
checkbox.label: Restart LP Google Service in every 8 hours

checkbox.description: Cron that updates AD-BLOCKER every week at SAT 6:00 AM, from official site. The cron will check if phone is connected to the internet, otherwise it will try to use WIFI! Script turns WIFI and DATA on, wait for connection and update and when it's finished, turns WIFI OFF. If there is no connection, an error will be written into the log. If you use other app for blocking adds, no need to use it.
checkbox.name: Update AD-Block
checkbox.label: Update AD-BLOCKER every week

checkbox.description: Cron for DB Optimization every day at 3:00 AM only if CPU is in idle.
checkbox.name: DB Optimization
checkbox.label: DB Optimization every day at 3:00 AM

checkbox.description: Cron for clearing app cache every day at 4:00 AM only if CPU is in idle.
checkbox.name: Clear app cache
checkbox.label: Disk Clean task every day at 4:00 AM

button.description: Check if CRON Task Jobs are done as requested. It will show the log for all finished jobs.
button.name: Test Cron Task Jobs
button.label: Test Cron Task Jobs

settingsPane.description: The notification LED has two brightness modes, depending on the external brightness detected by the light sensor.
settingsPane.name: Brightness

seekBar.description: LED brightness in low brightness environments.
seekBar.name: Low light environment brightness

seekBar.description: LED brightness in high brightness environments.
seekBar.name: Bright light environment brightness

settingsPane.description: Control the way the LED blinks. The LED controller has 4 type of slopes in its waveform, 2 rising slopes, and two falling slopes. The following configurables can control the blinking waveform.
settingsPane.name: Blinking effect

seekBar.description: Sets the time period of the two rising slopes (1,2), one time-unit is equal to 0.5 seconds.
seekBar.name: Fade-in time period

seekBar.description: Sets the time period of the two falling slopes (3,4), one time-unit is equal to 0.5 seconds.
seekBar.name: Fade-out time period

checkbox.description: If disabled, ignores the below detention times and the blinking waveform has no slopes, i.e. it is square.
checkbox.name: Enable fading
checkbox.label: Enable LED fading

seekBar.description: The LED is controlled by PWM/pulse wave modulation, the detention time dictates how long the controller spends time on a single step in its slope. One time-unit is equivalent to 4ms.
seekBar.name: Slope 1 detention time

settingsPane.name: Sound Control
settingsPane.description: Sound Control

seekBar.description: Headphone gain. Default: 40
seekBar.name: Headphone gain

seekBar.description: Headphone PowerAmp gain. Default: 12
seekBar.name: Headphone PA gain

seekBar.description: Speaker gain. Default: 40
seekBar.name: Speaker gain

seekBar.description: HDMI Speaker gain. Default: 40
seekBar.name: HDMI Speaker gain

seekBar.description: General Mic gain. Default: 40
seekBar.name: General Mic gain

seekBar.description: Camera Mic gain. Default: 40
seekBar.name: Camera Mic gain

seekBar.description: Headset Mic gain. Default: 40
seekBar.name: Headset Mic gain

settingsPane.description: AC and USB charging control
settingsPane.name: AC and USB charging control

spinner.description: This will force fast charging! (Disabled: Disabled | Use stock AC level on USB(Max 1000mA) | Use custom mA on AC and USB) (Default: Disabled)
spinner.name: Force Fast Charging

spinnerItem.name: Use stock AC level on USB(Max 1000mA)
Use custom mA on AC and USB

spinner.description: When enabled, mtp can be used during fast_charge. (Default: Enabled)
spinner.name: Use MTP during Fast Charging

spinner.description: Screen on current limit. (Default: Enabled)
spinner.name: Screen on current limit

spinner.description: Rate at which to charge when on AC (500 mA each hour to 1900 mA each hour). (Default: 1900 mA)
spinner.name: AC Charge Level

spinner.description: Rate at which to charge when on USB (460 mA each hour to 1000 mA each hour). (Default: 460 mA)
spinner.name: USB Charge Level

settingsPane.description: Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) uses a network congestion-avoidance algorithm that includes various aspects of an additive increase|multiplicative decrease (AIMD) scheme, with other schemes such as slow-start to achieve congestion avoidance. The TCP congestion-avoidance algorithm is the primary basis for congestion control in the Internet.
settingsPane.name: TCP Congestion control tweaks

spinner.description: Set TCP algorithm. (Default: Cubic)
spinner.name: tcp_congestion_control

settingsPane.description: Set some settings and options for your apps.
settingsPane.name: Apps

button.description: Click here to start applications Database Optimization. Compacting, cleaning and indexing will take max 2min.
button.name: DB OPTIMIZATION
button.label: DATABASE OPTIMIZATON

button.description: Click here to see current SELINUX status! Enforcing or Permissive globally. default is Permissive, you can switch to Enforcing with button below.
button.name: SELINUX STATUS CHECK
button.label: SELINUX STATUS CHECK

button.description: Touch here to set SELinux as Permissive or Enforcing. If SELinux is set as Permissive (Default: set on boot) then life is good and all works with no problems with GSM connection or access permissions with different apps. When you push this button ONCE, kernel command line will be updated and current kernel will reinstall automatic. To see changes you'll need to REBOOT! Then you can check using check button above. WARNING some USER apps loose some or all data (mostly configurations) when permissions changed! Do backup before change SELinux to Enforcing! When you'll reboot Dalvik Cache will be cleared out and kernel will reboot. Wait for apps to be optimized.
button.name: SELINUX PERMISSIVE/ENFORCING CONTROL
button.label: SELINUX PERMISSIVE/ENFORCING

spinner.description: Control to enable or disable logcat, logcat used to debug ROM services and apps, if you never used it, then keep it OFF, you get more battery and less CPU usage on idle.
spinner.name: Logcat ON/OFF

settingsPane.description: WIFI Settings
settingsPane.name: WIFI

button.description: Clean WIFI DHCP IP Lease. Push the button to activate!
button.name: Clean WIFI Lease
button.label: Clean WIFI Lease

settingsPane.description: Set GPS and NTP settings and options.
settingsPane.name: GPS - NTP

spinner.description: GPS-Time-Zone for faster GPS lock! Use your region!
spinner.name: GPS Region

button.description: Click to see your current GPS ZONE
button.name: GPS ZONE
button.label: GPS ZONE CHECK

button.description: Update time via NTP server
button.name: UPDATE TIME
button.label: UPDATE TIME

settingsPane.description: Add, Update or Remove AD Blocker! You need ROOT to do the tweak! If you want to update the blocker, you can push the UPDATE AD NOW button, to get the new one installed! If you install a new ROM, and you want to use AD BLOCKER, then push UPDATE AD NOW and REBOOT. If you need to REMOVE AD-BLOCKER use the REMOVE button and REBOOT
settingsPane.name: AD Blocker

button.description: ADD or UPDATE AD BLOCKER
button.name: AD-B UPDATE or ADD
button.label: UPDATE AD-B NOW

button.description: REMOVE AD Blocker
button.name: AD-B REMOVE
button.label: REMOVE AD-B NOW

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable INIT.D scripts RUN on boot. Many new ROMS are running the init.d scripts automatically. You can also force running the scripts, but if you run them and ROM runs them too, we have a problem: all scripts are running X2 times! To avoid conflicts, Stweaks RUN-control is disabled by default. If you know that your ROM is NOT supporting init.d script running, then turn it ON here and reboot.
checkbox.name: INIT.D Scripts RUN control
checkbox.label: Enable INIT.D scripts RUN-control

settingsPane.description: General tweaks
settingsPane.name: General tweaks

seekBar.description: Vibration force level. (Default: 75)
seekBar.name: Vibration force

button.description: Push Trim Now button in order to speed up Read and Write Access Time. It's good to use it once in a day or two, or let the cron to do it for you.
button.name: Trim System, Data and Cache
button.label: Trim NOW

settingsPane.description: USB and SDCARD settings and options.
settingsPane.name: USB - SDCARD

spinner.description: Set USB connection mode. Either leave it as default or force it to mass storage mode (you will see your ext sdcard as disk) or MTP.
spinner.name: USB mass storage mode

checkbox.description: If checked, Mass-Storage-ext-SDCARD will be auto-mounted when USB connected. then you can transfer files on high speed from PC to device. (Default: On) !!! Depends on CortexBrain-Background-Process !!!
checkbox.name: Auto Mount USB Drives
checkbox.label: Auto Mount USB Drives

button.description: Dual Mount-SDCARD and MMC via USB. After USB is disconnected, Dual Mount is disabled! This tweak is working automatically. Plug USB, turn off the screen and then turn ON, and you get working mounts. To scan your new MEDIA files, use some app to force Media Scan.
button.name: DUAL MOUNT
button.label: Dual Mount

settingsPane.description: Enable using Android phone as USB and Keyboard for your PC!, lets say you dont have keyboard and you really need one! connect your phone via usb get app named USB KEYBOARD, enable the tweak here, and have fun!
settingsPane.name: Android USB HID Device

spinner.description: Enable or Disable USB HID Device driver to control PC keyboard and mouse from phone!
spinner.name: USB HID Device

settingsPane.description: This script will manipulate many kernel settings, based on chosen STweaks profile + settings and on screen state (ON or OFF) and we call it CortexBrain. To reset the kernel-settings, after you disable a tweak, you must reboot!
settingsPane.name: CortexBrain Tweaks

spinner.description: Enable the background-process from CortexBrain. Disabling it means, losing the functions that sets different settings for screen state (ON/OFF).
spinner.name: CortexBrain-Background-Process

button.description: Click to see if the CortexBrain-Background-Process is running or not.
button.name: Check Background-Process
button.label: CHECK SERVICE

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable Memory-Tweaks (reboot needed).
checkbox.name: Memory-Tweaks
checkbox.label: Memory-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable System-Tweak (reboot needed).
checkbox.name: System-Tweaks
checkbox.label: System-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable Kernel-Tweaks (reboot needed).
checkbox.name: Kernel-Tweaks
checkbox.label: Kernel-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable CPU-Tweaks (reboot needed).
checkbox.name: CPU-Tweaks
checkbox.label: CPU-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable IO-Tweaks (reboot needed).
checkbox.name: IO-Tweaks
checkbox.label: IO-Tweaks

settingsPane.description: Load all kernel modules on boot, this will allow some extra functions.
settingsPane.name: Kernel Modules

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable CIFS Module. This will allow to use apps that can mount internal storage and publish over network. User can access data and system over network. No support, effect only after reboot!
checkbox.name: CIFS Module
checkbox.label: CIFS Module

settingsPane.description: Backup or restore your profile after installing new kernel. When you restore your configuration, please wait till this app restarts with the new settings. Some settings will work only after reboot! Restore will take up to 30 sec, just wait here!
settingsPane.name: STweaks Settings Backup or Restore

button.description: Backup STweaks User Settings!
button.name: Settings Backup
button.label: BACKUP NOW

button.description: Restore STweaks User Settings!
button.name: Settings Restore
button.label: RESTORE NOW

settingsPane.description: Debug to SD-Card.
settingsPane.name: Bug-Report

button.description: Bug-Report for Kernel, if a reboot or a freeze was performed and log was created with it's name part contains USELESS phase, then there is nothing to be done here. There is no need to upload it to thread for investigation.
button.name: Kernel Debug
button.label: KERNEL-CRASH-DEBUG

button.description: Active Kernel/System Debug Report, use to report BUG with kernel or system in LIVE, NOT after crash, reboot or freeze. if something is wrong, upload debug for investigation.
button.name: Kernel Active Debug
button.label: KERNEL-ACTIVE-DEBUG

button.description: Bug-Report for apps. Make sure that Logcat is Enabled before using this option. Remember, it's useless for kernel DEV and it's only needed for ROM DEV!
button.name: App-Bug
button.label: ROM-Logcat
